001package imagingbook.lib.util.bits;
002
003import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntInt;
004
005/**
006 * This class implements a true 2D bitmap container, i.e., each 0/1 element
007 * occupies only a single bit (unlike {@code boolean} arrays, which require at 
008 * least 8 bits per element).
009 * 
010 * @author WB
011 * @version 2021/01/30
012 */
013public class BitMap {
014        
015        /** the width of this bitmap */
016        private final int width;
017        /** the height of this bitmap */
018        private final int height;
019        
020        private final BitVector bitvec;
021        
022        /**
023         * Constructor.
024         * @param width the width of the new bitmap
025         * @param height the height of the new bitmap
026         */
027        public BitMap(int width, int height) {
028                this(width, height, null);
029        }
030        
031        /**
032         * Constructor.
033         * @param width width the width of the new bitmap
034         * @param height height the height of the new bitmap
035         * @param bytes a byte array, 0 maps to false, anything else to true
036         */
037        public BitMap(int width, int height, byte[] bytes) {
038                this.width = width;
039                this.height = height;
040                this.bitvec = (bytes != null) ? BitVector.from(bytes) : BitVector.create(width * height);
041        }
042        
043        public int getWidth() {
044                return this.width;
045        }
046        
047        public int getHeight() {
048                return this.height;
049        }
050        
051        /**
052         * Returns {@code true} is the specified element is set (1),
053         * {@code false} otherwise (0).
054         * @param x the x-coordinate
055         * @param y the y-coordinate
056         * @return as described
057         */
058        public boolean get(int x, int y) {
059                return bitvec.get(y * width + x);
060        }
061        
062        /**
063         * Returns {@code true} is the specified element is set (1),
064         * {@code false} otherwise (0).
065         * @param p the x/y-coordinate (point)
066         * @return as described
067         */
068        public boolean get(PntInt p) {
069                return bitvec.get(p.y * width + p.x);
070        }
071        
072        /**
073         * Sets the specified bit-element to the given boolean value
074         * (1 for {@code true}, 0 for {@code false}).
075         * @param x the x-coordinate
076         * @param y the y-coordinate
077         * @param val a boolean value
078         */
079        public void set(int x, int y, boolean val) {
080                if (val) {
081                        this.set(x, y);
082                }
083                else {
084                        this.unset(x, y);
085                }
086        }
087        
088        /**
089         * Sets the specified bit-element to the given boolean value
090         * (1 for {@code true}, 0 for {@code false}).
091         * @param p the x/y-coordinate (point)
092         * @param val a boolean value
093         */
094        public void set(PntInt p, boolean val) {
095                set(p.x, p.y, val);
096        }
097        
098        /**
099         * Sets the specified element (to bit-value 1).
100         * @param x the x-coordinate
101         * @param y the y-coordinate
102         */
103        public void set(int x, int y) {
104                bitvec.set(y * width + x);
105        }
106        
107        /**
108         * Sets the specified element (to bit-value 1).
109         * @param p the x/y-coordinate (point)
110         */
111        public void set(PntInt p) {
112                bitvec.set(p.y * width + p.x);
113        }
114        
115        /**
116         * Unsets the specified element (to bit-value 0).
117         * @param x the x-coordinate
118         * @param y the y-coordinate
119         */
120        public void unset(int x, int y) {
121                bitvec.unset(y * width + x);
122        }
123        
124        /**
125         * Unsets the specified element (to bit-value 0).
126         * @param p the x/y-coordinate (point)
127         */
128        public void unset(PntInt p) {
129                bitvec.unset(p.y * width + p.x);
130        }
131        
132        /**
133         * Sets all elements to 1.
134         */
135        public void setAll() {
136                bitvec.setAll();
137        }
138        
139        /**
140         * Sets all elements to 0.
141         */
142        public void unsetAll() {
143                bitvec.unsetAll();
144        }
145        
146        /**
147         * Returns the underlying 1D {@link BitVector}.
148         * @return the bit vector
149         */
150        public BitVector getBitVector() {
151                return this.bitvec;
152        }
153        
154        // static methods --------------------------------------------------
155        
156        /**
157         * Creates a new 2D bitmap of the specified size.
158         * @param width the width of the new bitmap
159         * @param height the height of the new bitmap
160         * @return the new bitmap
161         */
162        public static BitMap create(int width, int height) {
163                return new BitMap(width, height);
164        }
165        
166}
